experiment_info.name: candidate_weighted_ensemble
experiment_info.description: Create weighted ensemble of top-3 candidates to exploit diversity bonus
experiment_info.hypothesis: Weighted combination of candidates could better exploit diversity bonus

reason_aborted: DIVERSITY IS ALREADY SATURATED. niching_cmaes_diversity experiment proved: (1) Baseline already achieves 2.75/3 candidates (80% of samples get 3), (2) Adding diverse but worse candidates HURTS score due to averaging, (3) Accuracy is the bottleneck, not diversity.

niching_cmaes_diversity.finding_1: Baseline already achieves near-maximum diversity: ~80% of samples get 3 candidates, avg N_valid = 2.75
niching_cmaes_diversity.finding_2: The scoring formula penalizes diverse but worse candidates more than the diversity bonus helps
niching_cmaes_diversity.finding_3: Improving diversity can only gain ~0.025 in score (diversity is saturated)
niching_cmaes_diversity.quote: Diversity optimization is NOT a viable path

scoring_formula_analysis.insight: The first term AVERAGES accuracy over ALL candidates. Adding worse candidates hurts the average more than the 0.1 diversity bonus per candidate helps.

cmaes_restart_from_best.finding: Diversity is critical for scoring: The scoring formula heavily weights candidate diversity (0.3 * N_valid/3)

key_insight: The weighted ensemble approach would either (1) produce the same result as taking the best candidate if weights favor low-RMSE, or (2) hurt accuracy if trying to increase diversity. There is no path to improvement here.
